event.title: was founded and named Monomakh Slobidka (Мономахова Слободка) in 1907

data.event: The village was founded and named Monomakh Slobidka (Мономахова Слободка) in 1907 by settlers from Bryansk and Chernihiv.

event.title: 26 August 1949, by a decree of the Presidium of the Supreme Soviet, the village was renamed

data.event: On 26 August 1949, by a decree of the Presidium of the Supreme Soviet, the village was renamed again, now becoming Lazo (Лазо) in honour of the revolutionary hero Sergey Lazo (1894 - 1920).

event.title: 2 July 2007 the administrative head office for the "Call of the Tiger" National Park was established

data.event: On 2 July 2007 the administrative head office for the "Call of the Tiger" National Park was established in Lazo, at Lenin Street 23.

event.title: hit the headlines internationally at the end of 2005

data.event: Lazo hit the headlines internationally at the end of 2005 when it was reported that a stray dog was killed by squirrels in a Lazo park.

event.title: were alleged to be in a state of heightened frustration due to the absence, that year

data.event: The dog had barked at the squirrels who were alleged to be in a state of heightened frustration due to the absence, that year, of pine cones in the trees.
